byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and VANESSA PIAO

abstract: Confucius Peace Prize is given to Zimbabwe's 91-year-old president Robert Mugabe, whom Western nations have reviled as authoritarian; previous winners of prize, created by Chinese group as response to Nobel Peace Prize and carrying nearly $80,000 award, include Fidel Castro and Vladimir V Putin.
lead_paragraph: President Robert Mugabe, considered one of the most uncompromising rulers in Africa, is this year’s recipient of a Confucius Peace Prize, established in 2010.

headline.main: Zimbabwean President, Condemned by West, Is Selected for Chinese Peace Prize
headline.print_headline: Zimbabwean President, Condemned by West, Is Selected for Chinese Peace Prize

snippet: President Robert Mugabe, considered one of the most uncompromising rulers in Africa, is this year’s recipient of a Confucius Peace Prize, established in 2010.
